summary: The Primacy Certainty Act of 2025 amends the Safe Drinking Water Act to clarify the timeline for EPA decisions on state underground injection control (UIC) programs for Class VI wells (used for geologic sequestration of carbon dioxide).  It establishes deadlines for the EPA to act on state applications, including automatic approval if the EPA misses deadlines and transparency requirements. The bill also addresses pre-application activities, application coordination, and the use of Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (IIJA) funds related to UIC programs. It mandates a report to Congress on available resources.
